taskname: Skills Application - General - Whole Organ Excision
matched_description: The surgeon will remove the gallbladder. If ICG was administered during opional fluorescence imaging demo, then firefly can be used to visualize the extraphepatic ducts. "

Surgeon begins by tracing the right ovary and retracting the window of tissue as shown by the trainer. From here the surgeon will cauterize and transect the fallopian tube separating it from the uterine horn. Then the surgeon will practice using different energy to mobilize the uterine horn from the broad ligament. The surgeon will medially back and continue the mobilization as far down as easily assessable. These steps will then be repeated for the left side. Finally, the surgeon will use both Bipolar and Monopolar energy to cauterize and amputate the uterine body, freeing it. "

Surgeon begins by retracting the bladder anteriorly, so the suspensory ligaments are under tension and dome of the bladder is tucked behind the small grasping retractor. Then the surgeon will cauterize the left suspensory ligament with bipolar energy. Then using the monopolar curved scissors will cut the suspensory ligament where it was cauterized to expose the window between the medial and lateral leaf of the ligament. The surgeon then bluntly dissects revealing the ureter and will continue the dissection up to where the ureter inserts into the bladder. When finished on the left sided the surgeon will then complete the right side following the same steps. "

After completing the tool exchange and moving the endoscope to the port, the surgeon will begin with by retracting the sigmoid colon and locking it in place. This is done to reveal the superior rectal vein and artery. The surgeon then begins mobilizing a length of 3cm down the rectal vein and artery creating a window for the clip applier. The surgeon will then apply two clips to the proximal side of the artery and one to the distal leaving enough room for the vessel sealer between them. On the rectal vein one clip will be placed proximal and one placed distal leaving enough room for transection. Once the clips are placed the surgeon will transect both the rectal vein and artery with either the monopolar curved scissors or the vessel sealer.  "

taskname: Skills Application - General - Organ to Organ Anastomosis
matched_description: anastomosis tasks or for complete VUA; If suture breaks: stop to Segment out section of video where model is pulled out for proctor to address and restart (after model is placed back in the dome) new pickup of needle or suture  Note: This task may be utilized for several different dry lab studies. Therefore, start and stop times as well as task description may be subject to additional details for annotator alignment that are not fully captured in the card description"

Using the transected sigmoid  from previous exercise, the surgeon will position two sections of colon side by side using retraction arm as needed (further mobilization of colon may be preformed to allow for positioning). The surgein will then place proximal and distal stay stitches to hold the positioning. The sugeon will then create a small enterotomy, just large enough for the stapler to enter, on both sections. The stapler will then be inserted, and the jaws will be feed through the enterotomies. The stapler then will clamp dow on the colon and the surgeon will preform the stapler firing sequence. the surgeon will then complete the exerise with a single-layer closure of the now common enterotomy. "

The trainer will apply pressure to porcine body wall creating a target. The surgeon will then move all tools to this target while maintaining endoscopic view of all tools. This will be repeatd for the opposite side. Then finishing up the surgeon will move all intruments cephalad unitl the endoscope horizon disappears, and then wll return to the starting position "

Surgeon begins by retracting the bladder anteriorly, so the suspensory ligaments are under tension and dome of the bladder is tucked behind the small grasping retractor. The surgeon then bluntly dissects revealing the ureter and will continue the dissection up to where the ureter inserts into the bladder. When finished on the left sided the surgeon will then complete the right side following the same steps. "

The surgeon will switch the endoscope to 30degrees down before grasping the inferior portion of the sigmoid colon with the third arm. The surgeon will then retract the arm and lock it into place. The surgeon then marks 6 rows of 2 targets each with the monopolar scissors. Then the surgeon will exchange tools with mega needle driver being placed in the dominant hand and a large needle driver in the non-dominant. then the surgeon will complete the running suture using both hand-over-hand method and pulley method. This will be completed with special attention to tissue blanching and lack of movement in the knot.

After completing the tool exchange and moving the endoscope to the port, the surgeon will begin with by retracting the sigmoid colon and locking it in place. This is done to reveal the superior rectal vein and artery. The surgeon then begins mobilizing a length of 3cm down the rectal vein and artery creating a window for the clip applier. The surgeon will then apply two clips to the proximal side of the artery and one to the distal leaving enough room for the vessel sealer between them. On the rectal vein one clip will be placed proximal and one placed distal leaving enough room for transection. Once the clips are placed the surgeon will transect both the rectal vein and artery with either the monopolar curved scissors or the vessel sealer.  "

matched_description: Surgeon creates a 2cm long by 1.5 cm wide incision 15cm inferior to umbilicus at location of assistant palpation. The surgeon wil then suture the mesh to the wall using their prefered technique. The surgeon will then close the incision with their choice of suture technique.

The surgeon will grasp and retract the superior portion of the sigmoid colon caudally and lock into place. Then will mark 4 rows of 2 targets about one needle driver length apart along the sigmoid colon. After exchanging tools, the surgeon will grasp the suture and complete 4 interrupted sutures with a surgeon’s knot and 2 half-hitches all using two-handed robotic suturing technique. (knots are tied from left to right, or right to left with a main line swap between hands during the half-hitches)  "

After exchanging tools, the surgeon will now use one handed Robotic suturing techniques to complete 4 interrupted sutures each with a surgeon's knot and 2 half-hitches. (knots are tied vertically or from 12 to 6 o'clock positions or 6 to 12; for the half- hitches one hand will maintain grip on main line through the entire knot tying process) "

matched_description: Using the transected sigmoid  from previous exercise, the surgeon will position two sections of colon side by side using retraction arm as needed (further mobilization of colon may be preformed to allow for positioning). The surgein will then place proximal and distal stay stitches to hold the positioning. The sugeon will then create a small enterotomy, just large enough for the stapler to enter, on both sections. The stapler will then be inserted, and the jaws will be feed through the enterotomies. The stapler then will clamp dow on the colon and the surgeon will preform the stapler firing sequence. the surgeon will then complete the exerise with a single-layer closure of the now common enterotomy. "

taskname: Skills Application - General - Whole Organ Excision
matched_description: The surgeon will remove the gallbladder. If ICG was administered during opional fluorescence imaging demo, then firefly can be used to visualize the extraphepatic ducts. "
Excess bleeding occurs which requires surgeon to pause current task (energy, pressure, suctioning, suturing may be required)"
Excess bleeding occurs which requires surgeon to pause current task (energy, pressure, suctioning, suturing may be required)"
Separating the rectum and mesorectum from the lateral pelvic wall. Left side can be more difficult because of sub-optimal view (based on port placement)
Separating the rectum and mesorectum from the lateral pelvic wall. Left side can be more difficult because of sub-optimal view (based on port placement)
Separating the rectum and mesorectum from the lateral pelvic wall. Left side can be more difficult because of sub-optimal view (based on port placement)

Surgeon begins by tracing the right ovary and retracting the window of tissue as shown by the trainer. From here the surgeon will cauterize and transect the fallopian tube separating it from the uterine horn. Then the surgeon will practice using different energy to mobilize the uterine horn from the broad ligament. The surgeon will medially back and continue the mobilization as far down as easily assessable. These steps will then be repeated for the left side. Finally, the surgeon will use both Bipolar and Monopolar energy to cauterize and amputate the uterine body, freeing it. "
Separating the rectum and mesorectum from the lateral pelvic wall. Left side can be more difficult because of sub-optimal view (based on port placement)

The surgeon will switch the endoscope to 30degrees down before grasping the inferior portion of the sigmoid colon with the third arm. The surgeon will then retract the arm and lock it into place. The surgeon then marks 6 rows of 2 targets each with the monopolar scissors. Then the surgeon will exchange tools with mega needle driver being placed in the dominant hand and a large needle driver in the non-dominant. then the surgeon will complete the running suture using both hand-over-hand method and pulley method. This will be completed with special attention to tissue blanching and lack of movement in the knot.

Surgeon begins by retracting the bladder anteriorly, so the suspensory ligaments are under tension and dome of the bladder is tucked behind the small grasping retractor. Then the surgeon will cauterize the left suspensory ligament with bipolar energy. Then using the monopolar curved scissors will cut the suspensory ligament where it was cauterized to expose the window between the medial and lateral leaf of the ligament. The surgeon then bluntly dissects revealing the ureter and will continue the dissection up to where the ureter inserts into the bladder. When finished on the left sided the surgeon will then complete the right side following the same steps. "

After completing the tool exchange and moving the endoscope to the port, the surgeon will begin with by retracting the sigmoid colon and locking it in place. This is done to reveal the superior rectal vein and artery. The surgeon then begins mobilizing a length of 3cm down the rectal vein and artery creating a window for the clip applier. The surgeon will then apply two clips to the proximal side of the artery and one to the distal leaving enough room for the vessel sealer between them. On the rectal vein one clip will be placed proximal and one placed distal leaving enough room for transection. Once the clips are placed the surgeon will transect both the rectal vein and artery with either the monopolar curved scissors or the vessel sealer.  "

taskname: Skills Application - Gynecology - Simulated Cuff Closure
matched_description: Surgeon will retract the bladder anteriorly so that the ureters entering the bladder can be easily seen. The surgeon will then amputate the bladder 3cm above the ureters on an even plain.  The surgeon will then pexy the bladder with a suture on both sides to simulate the orientation of vaginal cuff. Once complete the surgeon will preform the vaginal cuff closure with the tools of their choice.

taskname: Skills Application - General - Lower Quadrant Abdominal Wall Suturing
matched_description: Suregon wil begin by creating a 4cm long by 3cm wide horizontal incision beginning at the location of palpation and extending medially. The surgeon will then place the  6cm mesh preperitoneal on the adominal wall and anchor with 3-4 interrupted sutures where desired. The surgeon will finish by closing the peritoneum with their preferred technique.

The surgeon will grasp and retract the superior portion of the sigmoid colon caudally and lock into place. Then will mark 4 rows of 2 targets about one needle driver length apart along the sigmoid colon. After exchanging tools, the surgeon will grasp the suture and complete 4 interrupted sutures with a surgeon’s knot and 2 half-hitches all using two-handed robotic suturing technique. (knots are tied from left to right, or right to left with a main line swap between hands during the half-hitches)  "

Surgeon will grasp the sigmoid colon directly inferior to the prior 2-handed stitching area and retract cephalad and lock the third arm in place. From there the surgeon mark 2 rows of 4 targets with monopolar scissors along the sigmoid colon all one needle driver's length apart. After exchanging tools, the surgeon will now use one handed Robotic suturing techniques to complete 4 interrupted sutures each with a surgeon's knot and 2 half-hitches. (knots are tied vertically or from 12 to 6 o'clock positions or 6 to 12; for the half- hitches one hand will maintain grip on main line through the entire knot tying process) "

Surgeon begins by retracting the bladder anteriorly, so the suspensory ligaments are under tension and dome of the bladder is tucked behind the small grasping retractor. Then the surgeon will cauterize the left suspensory ligament with bipolar energy. Then using the monopolar curved scissors will cut the suspensory ligament where it was cauterized to expose the window between the medial and lateral leaf of the ligament. The surgeon then bluntly dissects revealing the ureter and will continue the dissection up to where the ureter inserts into the bladder. When finished on the left sided the surgeon will then complete the right side following the same steps. "

The surgeon will switch the endoscope to 30degrees down before grasping the inferior portion of the sigmoid colon with the third arm. The surgeon will then retract the arm and lock it into place. This will be completed with special attention to tissue blanching and lack of movement in the knot.

After completing the tool exchange and moving the endoscope to the port, the surgeon will begin with by retracting the sigmoid colon and locking it in place. This is done to reveal the superior rectal vein and artery. The surgeon then begins mobilizing a length of 3cm down the rectal vein and artery creating a window for the clip applier. On the rectal vein one clip will be placed proximal and one placed distal leaving enough room for transection. Once the clips are placed the surgeon will transect both the rectal vein and artery with either the monopolar curved scissors or the vessel sealer.  "

matched_description: Using the transected sigmoid  from previous exercise, the surgeon will position two sections of colon side by side using retraction arm as needed (further mobilization of colon may be preformed to allow for positioning). The stapler then will clamp dow on the colon and the surgeon will preform the stapler firing sequence. the surgeon will then complete the exerise with a single-layer closure of the now common enterotomy. Using the transected sigmoid  from previous exercise, the surgeon will position two sections of colon side by side using retraction arm as needed (further mobilization of colon may be preformed to allow for positioning). The surgein will then place proximal and distal stay stitches to hold the positioning. The sugeon will then create a small enterotomy, just large enough for the stapler to enter, on both sections. The stapler will then be inserted, and the jaws will be feed through the enterotomies. The stapler then will clamp dow on the colon and the surgeon will preform the stapler firing sequence. the surgeon will then complete the exerise with a single-layer closure of the now common enterotomy. "

(knots are tied vertically or from 12 to 6 o'clock positions or 6 to 12; for the half- hitches one hand will maintain grip on main line through the entire knot tying process) "

Surgeon begins by retracting the bladder anteriorly, so the suspensory ligaments are under tension and dome of the bladder is tucked behind the small grasping retractor. Then the surgeon will cauterize the left suspensory ligament with bipolar energy. Then using the monopolar curved scissors will cut the suspensory ligament where it was cauterized to expose the window between the medial and lateral leaf of the ligament. The surgeon then bluntly dissects revealing the ureter and will continue the dissection up to where the ureter inserts into the bladder. When finished on the left sided the surgeon will then complete the right side following the same steps. "

The surgeon will switch the endoscope to 30degrees down before grasping the inferior portion of the sigmoid colon with the third arm. The surgeon will then retract the arm and lock it into place. The surgeon then marks 6 rows of 2 targets each with the monopolar scissors. Then the surgeon will exchange tools with mega needle driver being placed in the dominant hand and a large needle driver in the non-dominant. then the surgeon will complete the running suture using both hand-over-hand method and pulley method. This will be completed with special attention to tissue blanching and lack of movement in the knot.

After completing the tool exchange and moving the endoscope to the port, the surgeon will begin with by retracting the sigmoid colon and locking it in place. This is done to reveal the superior rectal vein and artery. The surgeon then begins mobilizing a length of 3cm down the rectal vein and artery creating a window for the clip applier. The surgeon will then apply two clips to the proximal side of the artery and one to the distal leaving enough room for the vessel sealer between them. On the rectal vein one clip will be placed proximal and one placed distal leaving enough room for transection. Once the clips are placed the surgeon will transect both the rectal vein and artery with either the monopolar curved scissors or the vessel sealer.  "
With larger hernia defect, extra closure might be required."

Using the transected sigmoid  from previous exercise, the surgeon will position two sections of colon side by side using retraction arm as needed (further mobilization of colon may be preformed to allow for positioning). The surgein will then place proximal and distal stay stitches to hold the positioning. The sugeon will then create a small enterotomy, just large enough for the stapler to enter, on both sections. The stapler will then be inserted, and the jaws will be feed through the enterotomies. The stapler then will clamp dow on the colon and the surgeon will preform the stapler firing sequence. the surgeon will then complete the exerise with a single-layer closure of the now common enterotomy. The trainer will apply pressure to porcine body wall creating a target. The surgeon will then move all tools to this target while maintaining endoscopic view of all tools. This will be repeatd for the opposite side. Then finishing up the surgeon will move all intruments cephalad unitl the endoscope horizon disappears, and then wll return to the starting position "

Surgeon begins by retracting the bladder anteriorly, so the suspensory ligaments are under tension and dome of the bladder is tucked behind the small grasping retractor. Then the surgeon will cauterize the left suspensory ligament with bipolar energy. Then using the monopolar curved scissors will cut the suspensory ligament where it was cauterized to expose the window between the medial and lateral leaf of the ligament. The surgeon then bluntly dissects revealing the ureter and will continue the dissection up to where the ureter inserts into the bladder. When finished on the left sided the surgeon will then complete the right side following the same steps. "

The surgeon will switch the endoscope to 30degrees down before grasping the inferior portion of the sigmoid colon with the third arm. The surgeon will then retract the arm and lock it into place. The surgeon then marks 6 rows of 2 targets each with the monopolar scissors. Then the surgeon will exchange tools with mega needle driver being placed in the dominant hand and a large needle driver in the non-dominant. then the surgeon will complete the running suture using both hand-over-hand method and pulley method. This will be completed with special attention to tissue blanching and lack of movement in the knot.

After completing the tool exchange and moving the endoscope to the port, the surgeon will begin with by retracting the sigmoid colon and locking it in place. This is done to reveal the superior rectal vein and artery. The surgeon then begins mobilizing a length of 3cm down the rectal vein and artery creating a window for the clip applier. The surgeon will then apply two clips to the proximal side of the artery and one to the distal leaving enough room for the vessel sealer between them. On the rectal vein one clip will be placed proximal and one placed distal leaving enough room for transection. Once the clips are placed the surgeon will transect both the rectal vein and artery with either the monopolar curved scissors or the vessel sealer.  "

The surgeon will grasp and retract the superior portion of the sigmoid colon caudally and lock into place. Then will mark 4 rows of 2 targets about one needle driver length apart along the sigmoid colon. After exchanging tools, the surgeon will grasp the suture and complete 4 interrupted sutures with a surgeon’s knot and 2 half-hitches all using two-handed robotic suturing technique. (knots are tied from left to right, or right to left with a main line swap between hands during the half-hitches)  "

Finally, the surgeon will use both Bipolar and Monopolar energy to cauterize and amputate the uterine body, freeing it. "

Then using the monopolar curved scissors will cut the suspensory ligament where it was cauterized to expose the window between the medial and lateral leaf of the ligament. The surgeon then bluntly dissects revealing the ureter and will continue the dissection up to where the ureter inserts into the bladder. When finished on the left sided the surgeon will then complete the right side following the same steps. "

Skills Application - General - Lower Quadrant Abdominal Wall Suturing
matched_description: Suregon wil begin by creating a 4cm long by 3cm wide horizontal incision beginning at the location of palpation and extending medially. The surgeon will then place the  6cm mesh preperitoneal on the adominal wall and anchor with 3-4 interrupted sutures where desired. The surgeon will finish by closing the peritoneum with their preferred technique.

taskname: Skills Application - General - Anterior Abdominal Wall Suturing
matched_description: Surgeon creates a 2cm long by 1.5 cm wide incision 15cm inferior to umbilicus at location of assistant palpation. The surgeon wil then suture the mesh to the wall using their prefered technique. The surgeon will then close the incision with their choice of suture technique.

To be used as a catch-all for surgical activity not already captured in any other defined task or tag. This is how you can add any additional clinical context. Comment in free text to briefly describe.

taskname: Skills Application - General - Lower Quadrant Abdominal Wall Suturing
matched_description: Suregon wil begin by creating a 4cm long by 3cm wide horizontal incision beginning at the location of palpation and extending medially. The surgeon will then place the  6cm mesh preperitoneal on the adominal wall and anchor with 3-4 interrupted sutures where desired. The surgeon will finish by closing the peritoneum with their preferred technique.

taskname: Skills Application - General - Lower Quadrant Abdominal Wall Suturing
matched_description: Suregon wil begin by creating a 4cm long by 3cm wide horizontal incision beginning at the location of palpation and extending medially. taskname: Skills Application - General - Whole Organ Excision
matched_description: The surgeon will remove the gallbladder. If ICG was administered during opional fluorescence imaging demo, then firefly can be used to visualize the extraphepatic ducts. "

The surgeon will grasp and retract the superior portion of the sigmoid colon caudally and lock into place. Then will mark 4 rows of 2 targets about one needle driver length apart along the sigmoid colon. After exchanging tools, the surgeon will grasp the suture and complete 4 interrupted sutures with a surgeon’s knot and 2 half-hitches all using two-handed robotic suturing technique. (knots are tied from left to right, or right to left with a main line swap between hands during the half-hitches)  "

Surgeon begins by tracing the right ovary and retracting the window of tissue as shown by the trainer. From here the surgeon will cauterize and transect the fallopian tube separating it from the uterine horn. Then the surgeon will practice using different energy to mobilize the uterine horn from the broad ligament. The surgeon will medially back and continue the mobilization as far down as easily assessable. These steps will then be repeated for the left side. Finally, the surgeon will use both Bipolar and Monopolar energy to cauterize and amputate the uterine body, freeing it. "

Surgeon will grasp the sigmoid colon directly inferior to the prior 2-handed stitching area and retract cephalad and lock the third arm in place. From there the surgeon mark 2 rows of 4 targets with monopolar scissors along the sigmoid colon all one needle driver's length apart. After exchanging tools, the surgeon will now use one handed Robotic suturing techniques to complete 4 interrupted sutures each with a surgeon's knot and 2 half-hitches. (knots are tied vertically or from 12 to 6 o'clock positions or 6 to 12; for the half- hitches one hand will maintain grip on main line through the entire knot tying process) "

Surgeon begins by retracting the bladder anteriorly, so the suspensory ligaments are under tension and dome of the bladder is tucked behind the small grasping retractor. Then the surgeon will cauterize the left suspensory ligament with bipolar energy. Then using the monopolar curved scissors will cut the suspensory ligament where it was cauterized to expose the window between the medial and lateral leaf of the ligament. The surgeon then bluntly dissects revealing the ureter and will continue the dissection up to where the ureter inserts into the bladder. When finished on the left sided the surgeon will then complete the right side following the same steps. "

The surgeon will switch the endoscope to 30degrees down before grasping the inferior portion of the sigmoid colon with the third arm. The surgeon will then retract the arm and lock it into place. The surgeon then marks 6 rows of 2 targets each with the monopolar scissors. Then the surgeon will exchange tools with mega needle driver being placed in the dominant hand and a large needle driver in the non-dominant. then the surgeon will complete the running suture using both hand-over-hand method and pulley method. This will be completed with special attention to tissue blanching and lack of movement in the knot.

After completing the tool exchange and moving the endoscope to the port, the surgeon will begin with by retracting the sigmoid colon and locking it in place. This is done to reveal the superior rectal vein and artery. The surgeon then begins mobilizing a length of 3cm down the rectal vein and artery creating a window for the clip applier. The surgeon will then apply two clips to the proximal side of the artery and one to the distal leaving enough room for the vessel sealer between them. On the rectal vein one clip will be placed proximal and one placed distal leaving enough room for transection. Once the clips are placed the surgeon will transect both the rectal vein and artery with either the monopolar curved scissors or the vessel sealer.  "

matched_description: Using the transected sigmoid  from previous exercise, the surgeon will position two sections of colon side by side using retraction arm as needed (further mobilization of colon may be preformed to allow for positioning). The surgein will then place proximal and distal stay stitches to hold the positioning. The sugeon will then create a small enterotomy, just large enough for the stapler to enter, on both sections. The stapler will then be inserted, and the jaws will be feed through the enterotomies. The stapler then will clamp dow on the colon and the surgeon will preform the stapler firing sequence. the surgeon will then complete the exerise with a single-layer closure of the now common enterotomy. "

retraction and collision avoidance,First exercise on the surgeon console. Trainers will review the functions of the surgeon console along with specific preferences (such as brightness and contrast). Then will move on to third arm retraction exercises. The goal of the exercise being how to position the third arm correctly and the interferences that can occur with incorrect positioning. The CSR will draw targets within on a gride (one at a time) and surgeon will demonstrate retraction with third arm along with repositioning of primary tools to the target. The endoscope will not be repositioned during and there are 6 targets. This will then be repeated but this time the bladder fundus will be retracted by the third arm to the target area.

The surgeon will grasp and retract the superior portion of the sigmoid colon caudally and lock into place. Then will mark 4 rows of 2 targets about one needle driver length apart along the sigmoid colon. After exchanging tools, the surgeon will grasp the suture and complete 4 interrupted sutures with a surgeon’s knot and 2 half-hitches all using two-handed robotic suturing technique. (knots are tied from left to right, or right to left with a main line swap between hands during the half-hitches)  "

Surgeon begins by tracing the right ovary and retracting the window of tissue as shown by the trainer. From here the surgeon will cauterize and transect the fallopian tube separating it from the uterine horn. Then the surgeon will practice using different energy to mobilize the uterine horn from the broad ligament. The surgeon will medially back and continue the mobilization as far down as easily assessable. These steps will then be repeated for the left side. Finally, the surgeon will use both Bipolar and Monopolar energy to cauterize and amputate the uterine body, freeing it. "

Surgeon will grasp the sigmoid colon directly inferior to the prior 2-handed stitching area and retract cephalad and lock the third arm in place. From there the surgeon mark 2 rows of 4 targets with monopolar scissors along the sigmoid colon all one needle driver's length apart. After exchanging tools, the surgeon will now use one handed Robotic suturing techniques to complete 4 interrupted sutures each with a surgeon's knot and 2 half-hitches. (knots are tied vertically or from 12 to 6 o'clock positions or 6 to 12; for the half- hitches one hand will maintain grip on main line through the entire knot tying process) "

taskname: Skills Application - Gynecology - Simulated Cuff Closure
matched_description: Surgeon will retract the bladder anteriorly so that the ureters entering the bladder can be easily seen. The surgeon will then amputate the bladder 3cm above the ureters on an even plain.  The surgeon will then pexy the bladder with a suture on both sides to simulate the orientation of vaginal cuff. Once complete the surgeon will preform the vaginal cuff closure with the tools of their choice.

The surgeon will grasp and retract the superior portion of the sigmoid colon caudally and lock into place. Then will mark 4 rows of 2 targets about one needle driver length apart along the sigmoid colon. After exchanging tools, the surgeon will grasp the suture and complete 4 interrupted sutures with a surgeon’s knot and 2 half-hitches all using two-handed robotic suturing technique. (knots are tied from left to right, or right to left with a main line swap between hands during the half-hitches)  "

(knots are tied vertically or from 12 to 6 o'clock positions or 6 to 12; for the half- hitches one hand will maintain grip on main line through the entire knot tying process) "

After completing the tool exchange and moving the endoscope to the port, the surgeon will begin with by retracting the sigmoid colon and locking it in place. This is done to reveal the superior rectal vein and artery. The surgeon then begins mobilizing a length of 3cm down the rectal vein and artery creating a window for the clip applier. The surgeon will then apply two clips to the proximal side of the artery and one to the distal leaving enough room for the vessel sealer between them. On the rectal vein one clip will be placed proximal and one placed distal leaving enough room for transection. Once the clips are placed the surgeon will transect both the rectal vein and artery with either the monopolar curved scissors or the vessel sealer.  "
